thread.title: Highlights from St. John's Red Storm Tip-Off
thread.title_full: Highlights from St. John's Red Storm Tip-Off

title: Highlights from St. John's Red Storm Tip-Off
text:
Highlights from St. John's Red Storm Tip-Off 
Chris Mullin was welcomed with a loud ovation from the crowd at Carnesecca Arena. Brad Penner-USA TODAY Sports Oct 17, 2015 at 2:16p ET 0Shares 
St. John's held its annual Red Storm Tip-Off on Friday night at Carnesecca Arena. The event featured 10 new faces and one legendary homecoming. 
First-year head coach Chris Mullin, who led the Johnnies to the 1985 Final Four, received a loud ovation from the Carnesecca crowd. 
However, St. John's President Conrado "Bobby" Gempesaw decided to remind Mullin who is still in charge, jokingly assessing the new coach with a technical foul as a special referee in the intrasquad scrimmage. true Chris Mullin picked up his first technical foul from @StJohnsU President Conrado "Bobby" Gempesaw, Ph.D. #SJUBB pic.twitter.com/MuqAsRWNWl â€” St. John's BBall (@StJohnsBBall) October 17, 2015 
Here are all the highlight's from Friday's Red Storm Tip-Off: true
